# Python String Methods

## Introduction
String methods in Python are built-in functions that allow you to manipulate and analyze text strings. These methods are essential for text processing and string manipulation.

## Concept Overview
Python strings are immutable sequences of characters that come with many useful methods. These methods can transform case, search for substrings, replace text, and more.

## Common String Methods

```python
# Basic string methods
text = 'Hello, World!'
print(text.lower())      # hello, world!
print(text.upper())      # HELLO, WORLD!
print(text.strip())      # removes whitespace
print(text.replace('Hello', 'Hi'))  # Hi, World!
```

```python
# Search and validation methods
text = 'Python Programming'
print(text.startswith('Python'))  # True
print(text.endswith('ming'))      # True
print(text.find('gram'))          # 8
print(text.isalpha())             # False
```

## Key Points
- String methods don't modify the original string
- Methods return a new string with the changes
- String methods are case-sensitive by default
- Most methods have both case-sensitive and case-insensitive variants

## Common Mistakes
- Trying to modify strings directly (they're immutable)
- Forgetting that methods return new strings
- Not checking if a string is empty before using certain methods

## Practice
Try these exercises:
```python
# 1. Convert a string to title case
name = 'john doe'
name = name.title()  # John Doe

# 2. Check if a string contains only digits
phone = '12345'
phone.isdigit()  # True
```
